title.narrative: COVID-19 RESPONSE

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: External Relations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: Given the abrupt change in the situation brought about by the pandemic, UNICEF Mexico supported the Ministry of Education (MoE) in responding to the school closures and the sector’s immediate need to offer alternative and remote ways of learning. The “Salud en tus manos” initiative benefited90,669 students in 394 schools and reached 845,000 teachers in the country. UNICEF also initiated actions to promote maternal, neonatal and child health in the context of COVID-19 through its partnership with CADENA. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
